ratings.comment: good class, or at least at par with similar UW econ classes. fun teacher who seems to care: extra office hours before exams and quick at answering emails

He is far from a good professor. His lecture slides are useful, just not in the actual lecture but rather when trying to study for an exam.  Speaking of exams they are rather ridiculously graded.  I wouldn't recommend this professor but unfortunately I think he is the only professor that teaches this class. If you have to take his class, good luck.
Francesco is shy but overall a good professor. His class isnt easy but he wants his students to do well and is responsive if you have questions.
I basically learn most of the course materials from reading the textbook and go to discussions. If you want to do well in this class, better hope for a good TA or have excellent self-study skill.
Overall, a interesting Professor, but Lectures can be vague at times. If you do the practice problems, read the book, and have a decent TA you should do fine.
Nice guy, but a bad teacher. Lectures are ineffective and useless, and exams are unpredictable. Pray for a good TA.

Horrible teacher, doesn't give solutions to any practice material, doesn't show steps involved in solving problems, basically you have to teach yourself the entire class. going to lecture is pointless
Professor Decarolis is bad. Plain and simple he doesn't know how to teach effectively.
Lectures and discussions are not helpful at all. Make sure you did the exercises in the book and dont forget to buy solution problem for the book.
A better way to study for the class is studying by yourself. Totally goes by the math calculations without any associations to the real-world applications.
